Description: Rim sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; lotus bud in added white outline with added red centres above two white bands; top of rim glazed; exterior: broken maeander pattern between bands at rim; below, painted decoration consisting of foreparts of grazing goat (red patches on side and neck) to right; part of rising triangle and possible rosette as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Goats are not frequently found on vessels of the Mature Animal Style.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 257, no. 473, pl. 65)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0557) (phase 2)
